doctor.name: Dr. Alexander Bonakdar
doctor.bio1: Dr. Alexander Bonakdar chose Orange County in 1995 specifically for its diverse population and unique environmental eye health challenges. After completing his Doctor of Optometry degree at UC Berkeley, he established his practice to serve Orange County's Mediterranean climate-related conditions, from Santa Ana winds dry eye to marine layer effects.
doctor.bio2: In 30 years serving Orange County, Dr. Bonakdar has treated over 50,000 residents, specializing in environmental adaptations for OC's climate. His expertise in keratoconus management, dry eye treatment, and contact lens fittings has made him the referral choice for UCI Health, CHOC, and three generations of Orange County families from tech workers to retirees.

hero.title: Advanced Dry Eye Treatment
hero.description: Comprehensive diagnosis and treatment for dry eye syndrome using the latest technology including IPL therapy, LipiFlow, and personalized treatment plans.

understanding.title: Understanding
understanding.paragraph1: Dry eye syndrome is a common condition that occurs when tears aren't able to provide adequate lubrication for your eyes. This can happen when your eyes don't produce enough tears or when the tears evaporate too quickly.
understanding.paragraph2: Modern lifestyle factors such as increased screen time, environmental conditions, and certain medications can contribute to dry eye symptoms. The condition can range from mild irritation to severe discomfort that significantly impacts daily activities.
understanding.paragraph3: At Eye Care Center of OC, we use advanced diagnostic technology to identify the specific type and underlying cause of your dry eye condition, allowing us to create a personalized treatment plan that addresses your unique needs.
understanding.imageAlt: Dry eye condition illustration showing tear film dysfunction
understanding.subtitle: What You Need to Know
understanding.description: Dry eye syndrome is a common condition that occurs when tears aren't able to provide adequate lubrication for your eyes.

evaporative.title: Evaporative Dry Eye
evaporative.description: Most common type caused by blocked meibomian glands

aqueous.title: Aqueous Deficient
aqueous.description: Insufficient tear production by lacrimal glands

mixed.title: Mixed Type
mixed.description: Combination of both evaporative and aqueous deficient

treatments.title: Comprehensive
treatments.subtitle: We offer a range of effective treatments tailored to your specific dry eye condition and symptoms.

options.title: Artificial Tears
options.description: Premium lubricating drops to supplement natural tear production and provide temporary relief.

options.title: Prescription Medications
options.description: Specialized medications to increase tear production or reduce inflammation associated with dry eye.

options.title: Punctal Plugs
options.description: Tiny devices inserted into tear ducts to prevent drainage, keeping eyes moist longer.

treatment.title: Advanced Treatment Options
treatment.description: Our comprehensive approach addresses the root causes of dry eye syndrome with proven therapies.

artificial.title: Artificial Tears
artificial.description: Premium lubricating drops to supplement natural tear production and provide temporary relief.

prescription.title: Prescription Medications
prescription.description: Specialized medications to increase tear production or reduce inflammation associated with dry eye.

punctal.title: Punctal Plugs
punctal.description: Tiny devices inserted into tear ducts to prevent drainage, keeping eyes moist longer.

ipl.title: Intense Pulsed Light (IPL) Therapy
ipl.description1: IPL is a revolutionary treatment for dry eye disease that targets the underlying causes rather than just the symptoms. Using specific wavelengths of light, IPL reduces inflammation around the eyelids and improves meibomian gland function.
ipl.description2: This non-invasive procedure takes only minutes to perform and provides lasting relief for many patients suffering from chronic dry eye disease.

benefits.title: Long-lasting Relief
benefits.description: Unlike eye drops that provide temporary comfort, IPL addresses the root causes for sustained relief from dry eye symptoms.

benefits.title: Reduced Inflammation
benefits.description: IPL therapy effectively reduces inflammation around the eyelids, helping to restore normal tear film function.

benefits.title: Quick & Comfortable
benefits.description: Treatment sessions take only minutes to complete with minimal discomfort and no downtime required.

ipl.glandImagingDescription: Advanced imaging technology allows us to examine the structure of your meibomian glands and identify any dysfunction or blockages.
ipl.tearFilmDescription: We evaluate tear quality, quantity, and evaporation rate using specialized equipment to determine the specific type of dry eye you're experiencing.
ipl.testimonialQuote1: After struggling with dry eyes for years, the comprehensive testing at Eye Care Center of OC finally pinpointed my specific problem. Now I'm getting treatment that actually works!
ipl.testimonialQuote2: The IPL treatment has been life-changing. My eyes feel more comfortable than they have in years, and I'm not constantly reaching for eye drops anymore.

diagnostics.subtitle: Our advanced diagnostic approach allows us to precisely identify the cause and severity of your dry eye condition.
diagnostics.description: No more generic treatments. Our comprehensive testing reveals the exact factors contributing to your dry eye symptoms, allowing for truly personalized care.
diagnostics.whatToExpectTitle: What to Expect During Your Comprehensive Evaluation
diagnostics.pathToReliefTitle: Your Path to Dry Eye Relief
diagnostics.pathToReliefDescription: At Eye Care Center of OC, we believe that accurate diagnosis is the foundation of effective dry eye treatment. Our state-of-the-art diagnostic process combines the latest technology with clinical expertise to identify the specific factors contributing to your dry eye symptoms.

tests.title: Tear Film Analysis
tests.description: Comprehensive evaluation of tear quality, quantity, and stability using advanced diagnostic equipment.

tests.title: Meibomian Gland Imaging
tests.description: High-resolution imaging to assess the structure and function of your oil-producing glands.

tests.title: Corneal Surface Assessment
tests.description: Detailed examination of the corneal surface to identify areas of damage or inflammation.

testimonials.quote: The detailed testing showed me exactly why my eyes were so uncomfortable. Now I finally have a treatment plan that works!
testimonials.author: Sarah M.

testimonials.quote: I never knew there were so many different types of dry eye. Dr. Bonakdar's thorough evaluation changed everything.
testimonials.author: Robert K.

processSteps.title: Initial Assessment
processSteps.description: Comprehensive review of your symptoms, medical history, and lifestyle factors.

processSteps.title: Advanced Testing
processSteps.description: State-of-the-art diagnostic tests to measure tear production, quality, and evaporation.

processSteps.title: Personalized Analysis
processSteps.description: Detailed analysis of results to create your customized treatment plan.

results.title: Treatment
results.subtitle: See the dramatic improvements our patients experience with our advanced dry eye treatments.
results.imageCaption: Meibomian gland imaging showing improved function after IPL treatment

cta.title: Ready to Find Relief from Dry Eye Symptoms?
cta.description: Take the first step toward comfortable, healthy eyes with our comprehensive dry eye evaluation and personalized treatment plan.

hero.title: Keratoconus Treatment & Management
hero.subtitle: Advanced diagnosis and treatment options for keratoconus including specialty contact lenses and surgical interventions

understanding.title: Understanding
understanding.paragraph1: Keratoconus is a progressive eye condition where the cornea gradually thins and bulges outward into a cone-like shape. This irregular corneal shape causes light to scatter as it enters the eye, resulting in distorted and blurred vision.
understanding.paragraph2: Early detection and treatment are crucial for managing keratoconus effectively. Our advanced diagnostic technology allows us to identify the condition in its earliest stages, when treatment options are most effective.
understanding.paragraph3: With proper management, most patients with keratoconus can maintain good vision and quality of life. Our comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge treatments with personalized care to achieve the best possible outcomes.

treatment.title: Corneal Cross-Linking Treatment
treatment.subtitle: Our advanced corneal cross-linking treatment is designed to halt the progression of keratoconus and preserve your vision for the long term.

benefits.title: Benefits of Corneal Cross-Linking
list: Halts the progression of keratoconus in over 95% of cases
Reduces the need for corneal transplantation
Minimally invasive outpatient procedure
FDA-approved treatment
May improve vision in some patients
Preserves long-term visual function

howItWorks.title: How Corneal Cross-Linking Works
howItWorks.description: Corneal cross-linking (CXL) is a minimally invasive procedure that strengthens the corneal tissue to prevent further bulging of the cornea. The procedure combines the use of ultraviolet (UV) light and riboflavin (vitamin B2) eye drops to create new bonds between collagen fibers within the cornea.
howItWorks.button: Learn if Cross-Linking is Right for You

stats.title: Keratoconus Treatment
stats.subtitle: Our specialized approach to keratoconus management has helped thousands of patients achieve better vision and improved quality of life.

scleralLenses.title: Scleral Lenses for Keratoconus
scleralLenses.subtitle: Custom-designed scleral lenses provide exceptional comfort and vision for patients with keratoconus.

howTheyWork.title: How Scleral Lenses Work
howTheyWork.description: Scleral lenses are specially designed to vault over the cornea, creating a fluid-filled reservoir between the lens and the corneal surface. This design offers several advantages: the fluid layer compensates for corneal irregularities, creating a smooth optical surface; the lens rests on the less sensitive sclera rather than the cornea, improving comfort; the fluid reservoir continuously bathes the cornea, providing relief for dry eye symptoms that often accompany keratoconus; and the rigid material provides superior optics compared to soft lenses.

fittingProcess.title: The Scleral Lens Fitting Process
fittingProcess.description: Fitting scleral lenses requires specialized expertise and technology. Our process includes comprehensive corneal mapping using advanced topography, custom lens design based on your unique corneal shape, trial lens evaluation to assess fit and vision, detailed training on insertion, removal, and care, and follow-up appointments to ensure optimal fit and comfort.

benefits.title: Benefits of Scleral Lenses
list: Dramatically improved vision quality - Creates a smooth optical surface that corrects irregular astigmatism
All-day comfort - Even for patients who couldn't tolerate other contact lenses
Protection of the corneal surface - The fluid reservoir provides a cushioning effect
Reduced progression of keratoconus - In some cases by preventing mechanical trauma
Relief from dryness and irritation - The fluid reservoir continuously bathes the eye
May delay or avoid corneal transplant - For patients with advanced keratoconus

scleralLenses.button: Learn if Scleral Lenses are Right for You

intacs.title: Intacs Corneal Implants
intacs.subtitle: Tiny, clear inserts placed in the periphery of the cornea to reshape its surface and improve vision in keratoconus patients.

howTheyWork.title: How Intacs Work
howTheyWork.description: The procedure works by mechanically reshaping the cornea from within. When strategically placed in the periphery of the cornea, Intacs flatten the steep area of the cornea, improving the cornea's overall shape and reducing visual distortions caused by keratoconus.

benefits.title: Benefits of Intacs
list: Minimally invasive procedure with quick recovery
Reversible ‚Äì implants can be removed if necessary
Can significantly improve vision in suitable candidates
May delay or prevent the need for corneal transplant
Can be combined with other treatments like corneal cross-linking
Often allows patients to wear contact lenses more comfortably

intacs.button: Learn if Intacs are Right for You

diagnostics.title: Advanced Diagnosis
diagnostics.subtitle: We use state-of-the-art technology to accurately diagnose and monitor keratoconus.

technology.title: Diagnostic Technology
list: Corneal Topography: Creates detailed 3D maps of the corneal surface
Anterior Segment OCT: Captures high-resolution cross-sectional images of the cornea
Pachymetry: Measures corneal thickness at various points
Wavefront Aberrometry: Measures optical aberrations affecting vision quality
Biomechanical Assessment: Evaluates the strength and resilience of corneal tissue

stages.title: Stages of Keratoconus
stages.description: Our diagnostic process can determine your stage of keratoconus:
list: Early Stage: Mild corneal thinning, slight visual distortion
Moderate Stage: Increased corneal steepening, more noticeable vision changes
Advanced Stage: Significant corneal thinning and protrusion
Severe Stage: Extreme thinning, scarring, and pronounced corneal distortion
stages.conclusion: Early diagnosis is crucial‚Äîthe sooner keratoconus is detected, the more treatment options are available to preserve your vision.

treatmentOptions.title: Complete Treatment Solutions
treatmentOptions.subtitle: At Eyecare Center of OC, we offer comprehensive keratoconus management tailored to your specific needs and condition severity.

options.title: Corneal Cross-Linking
options.description: FDA-approved procedure that strengthens corneal tissue to halt keratoconus progression using UV light and riboflavin drops.

options.title: Specialty Contact Lenses
options.description: Custom-designed rigid gas permeable (RGP), scleral, or hybrid lenses that provide clear vision by creating a new optical surface.

options.title: Intacs Corneal Implants
options.description: Tiny, clear inserts placed within the cornea to reshape its surface and improve vision in patients with keratoconus.

options.title: Custom Prescription Eyewear
options.description: Specialized glasses with unique prescriptions can help manage mild cases or provide supplementary vision correction.

options.title: Topography-Guided PRK
options.description: Advanced laser procedure that reshapes the cornea based on detailed topographic measurements for improved vision.

options.title: Corneal Transplantation
options.description: For advanced cases, surgical replacement of the central cornea with healthy donor tissue to restore corneal function.

treatmentComparison.title: Treatment Comparison
treatmentComparison.subtitle: Compare the different treatment options for keratoconus to understand which approach might be best for your specific condition.

crossLinking.title: Corneal Cross-Linking
crossLinking.description: A minimally invasive procedure that strengthens corneal tissue to halt keratoconus progression.
benefits: May prevent need for corneal transplant
Most effective in early to moderate stages

scleralLenses.title: Scleral Lenses
scleralLenses.description: Specialized contact lenses that vault over the cornea, providing clear vision for keratoconus patients.
benefits: Can be worn for long periods
Works for all stages of keratoconus

intacs.title: Intacs
intacs.description: Micro-thin inserts placed in the cornea to flatten the cone and reduce distortion.

cta.title: Take Control of Your Keratoconus
cta.subtitle: Don't let keratoconus compromise your vision quality. Our specialized treatments can help preserve your sight and improve your visual clarity.

hero.title: Orthokeratology (Ortho-K)
hero.subtitle: Non-surgical vision correction and myopia control using overnight contact lenses

understanding.title: Understanding
understanding.paragraph1: Orthokeratology, or Ortho-K, is a revolutionary non-surgical vision correction treatment that uses specially designed contact lenses worn overnight to gently reshape your cornea while you sleep. When you wake up and remove the lenses, you can see clearly throughout the day without glasses or contact lenses.
understanding.paragraph2: This FDA-approved treatment is particularly effective for myopia (nearsightedness) control in children and teenagers, helping to slow the progression of nearsightedness. It's also an excellent option for adults who want freedom from glasses and daytime contact lenses.

benefits.title: Benefits of Ortho-K
benefits.item1: Clear vision all day without glasses or contacts
benefits.item3: Reversible - stop anytime to return to original vision
benefits.item4: Great for active lifestyles and sports

process.title: The Ortho-K Process
process.subtitle: Orthokeratology is a multi-step process that requires precise measurements and custom lens fitting to achieve optimal results.

steps.title: Comprehensive Exam
steps.description: We perform a detailed corneal topography mapping and comprehensive eye examination to determine if you're a good candidate for Ortho-K.

steps.title: Custom Lens Design
steps.description: Your Ortho-K lenses are custom-designed based on the unique shape of your cornea and your specific vision correction needs.

steps.title: Lens Fitting
steps.description: We ensure your lenses fit perfectly and provide detailed instructions on how to insert, remove, and care for your Ortho-K lenses.

steps.title: Overnight Wear
steps.description: You'll wear your Ortho-K lenses while sleeping. The lenses gently reshape your cornea to correct your vision while you rest.

steps.title: Clear Daytime Vision
steps.description: Remove the lenses in the morning and enjoy clear vision throughout the day without glasses or contact lenses.

steps.title: Follow-up Care
steps.description: Regular check-ups ensure your Ortho-K treatment is working effectively and make adjustments as needed for optimal results.

benefits.title: Benefits of Orthokeratology
benefits.subtitle: Ortho-K offers numerous advantages over traditional vision correction methods.

list.title: Freedom From Daytime Eyewear
list.description: Enjoy clear vision throughout the day without wearing glasses or contact lenses, perfect for active lifestyles.

list.title: Slows Myopia Progression
list.description: Clinical studies show Ortho-K can significantly slow the progression of nearsightedness in children and young adults.

list.title: Non-Surgical Solution
list.description: Achieve vision correction without the risks associated with laser eye surgery. Ortho-K is completely reversible.

list.title: Comfortable and Convenient
list.description: Lenses are only worn while sleeping, eliminating daytime discomfort that some contact lens wearers experience.

list.title: Excellent for Sports & Activities
list.description: Ideal for swimmers, athletes, and people working in dusty or dry environments where glasses or contacts are problematic.

list.title: Cost-Effective Long-Term
list.description: While the initial investment is higher than regular contacts, Ortho-K can be more cost-effective over time compared to daily disposable lenses.

myopiaManagement.title: Myopia Management
myopiaManagement.subtitle: Ortho-K is one of the most effective treatments for slowing myopia progression in children and teenagers.
myopiaManagement.description: Myopia (nearsightedness) is becoming increasingly common in children. Studies show that Ortho-K can slow myopia progression by 50-90%, reducing the risk of serious eye problems later in life.
benefits: Provides clear daytime vision without glasses

whyImportant.title: Why Myopia Control is Important
whyImportant.description: High myopia increases the risk of serious eye conditions including retinal detachment, glaucoma, and macular degeneration. By controlling myopia progression early, we can help protect your child's long-term eye health and vision.

cta.title: Take Control of Your Child's Myopia Today
cta.subtitle: Don't wait until your child's prescription gets stronger. Early intervention with Ortho-K can help slow myopia progression and reduce the risk of eye problems later in life.

understanding.title: Understanding Headaches
understanding.paragraph1: Eye strain and vision-related headaches are increasingly common in our digital age. These uncomfortable symptoms can significantly impact your daily productivity, comfort, and overall quality of life.
understanding.paragraph2: Understanding the connection between your eyes and headaches is crucial for finding effective relief. Our comprehensive approach addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes to provide lasting solutions.

didYouKnow.title: Did You Know?
didYouKnow.fact: Up to 90% of people who work on computers experience some form of eye strain, which can lead to headaches and reduced productivity.

understanding.imageAlt: Person experiencing headache and eye strain

prevention.title: Prevention
prevention.description: Implement these practical strategies in your daily routine to reduce eye fatigue and prevent related headaches.

rule2020.title: The 20-20-20 Rule
rule2020.description: Every 20 minutes, look at something 20 feet away for at least 20 seconds to reduce eye strain during extended screen time.

lighting.title: Proper Lighting
lighting.description: Ensure your workspace has adequate, non-glare lighting that doesn't create reflections on your screen or cause you to squint.

ergonomic.title: Ergonomic Setup
ergonomic.description: Position your screen about arm's length away and slightly below eye level. Use an ergonomic chair that supports good posture.

hydration.title: Stay Hydrated
hydration.description: Drinking plenty of water helps maintain moisture in your eyes and can reduce symptoms of eye fatigue.

blinking.title: Regular Blinking
blinking.description: Consciously remind yourself to blink regularly during screen time, as we tend to blink less when focusing on digital devices.

screenSettings.title: Screen Settings
screenSettings.description: Adjust brightness, contrast, and text size on your devices to comfortable levels. Enable blue light filters, especially in the evening.

eyewear.title: Specialized Eyewear Solutions
eyewear.description: Consider specialized eyewear solutions like computer glasses with blue light filtering, anti-reflective coatings, and optimized prescriptions specifically for digital device use. Our opticians can help you find the perfect eyewear to reduce strain and prevent headaches.

cta.title: Get Relief from Headaches and Eye Fatigue
cta.subtitle: Don't let eye strain and headaches impact your productivity and quality of life. Our specialized care can help you find lasting relief.
